text.__SUMMARY__: Conus largilliertii, common name Largilliert's cone, is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.These snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 30 mm and 60 mm. The spire is rather elevated and is maculated. Its color is light chestnut, with darker revolving lines of spots, and usually a white central band.
text.Distribution: This marine species occurs in the Caribbean Sea and the Gulf of Mexico  from Florida to Mexico; in the Atlantic Ocean off South Carolina, USA.
text.References:
